meaning: To make twisting or turning movements; contort the body, as in agony; squirm.
To move with a twisting or contorted motion.
To suffer great emotional distress, as from embarrassment or revulsion.
To cause to twist or turn; contort.

Part or all of this entry has been imported from the 1913 edition of Webster's Dictionary, which is now free of copyright and hence in the public domain. The imported definitions may be significantly out of date, and any more recent senses may be completely missing.
(knot theory) The number of negative crossings subtracted from the number of positive crossings in a knot.
sentences: She did not writhe in pain, nor snarl, nor foam at the mouth.
Another vast concussion made the ground writhe under the flying feet of his mount.
When my partner moves it in and out too I writhe about in ecstasy !
